Name: Checklist - ITP001 - CG - Clear and Grub - Rev1
Prompting Name: Checklist - ITP001 - CG - Clear and Grub

Name: Specifications - The contractor shall be responsible for engaging a licensed surveyor of Australia approved by the Superintendent to set out all works in accordance with the design drawings prior to the commencement of the works.
Specifications - Contractor shall take reasonable steps to locate all existing service on the Site. Where existing services are identified they shall be clearly marked for the duration of the works.
Specifications - Location of works identified in accordance with the Project Technical Specifications.
Specifications - Clearing shall be performed within the limits of the works indicated on the drawings.
○ Trees, shrubs, logs, debris, perishable material, organic matter, fallen trees, overhanging branches and surface obstructions shall be removed from the stripping area.
Specifications - Roots from trees and large shrubs shall be excavated to the extent to be agreed with the Superintendent.
Specifications - Cleared and grubbed materials shall be stockpiled or disposed of as directed by the superintendent
Specifications - Holes created by grubbing shall be filled with materials approved by the Company’s Representative and compacted to a density approved by the Company’s Representative
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP002 - Top Soil Stripping - Rev1

Specifications - The contractor shall be responsible for engaging a licensed surveyor of Australia approved by the Superintendent to set out all works in accordance with the design drawings prior to the commencement of the works.
Specifications - Location of works identified in accordance with the Project Technical Specifications
Specifications - Topsoil shall be stripped such that all organic rich soil and roots/rootlets has been removed from the foundation of the embankment and internal borrow areas
○ Topsoil shall be stripped to the depth(s) 200mm indicated on BOQ. Any areas with depth greater than 200mm should be notified to the superintendent.
Specifications - Stripped topsoil shall be stockpiled where directed by the Superintendent, for reuse. Topsoil Stockpiles to be ameliorated and treated as per company’s directions.
○ Topsoil is to be placed in a loose, non-compacted state, to a maximum height of 3 metres
Specifications - As-constructed survey has been completed to record the surface levels on completion of topsoil stripping.
○ The Contractor shall submit results of each survey to the superintendent within 48hours of undertaking the Survey.
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP003 - FP - Foundation Preparation - Rev1
Specifications - Location of work identified in accordance with project technical specification
Specifications - Compaction trial for general fill will be completed and approved by the client
Specifications - Foundation preparation of Lot will be inspected for material type, moisture and organic material prior to foundation preparation works.

Specifications - Subgrade shall be Proof Rolled in accordance with Queensland Department of Main Roads Technical Specification (MRTS) 04 General Earthworks Section 18.3.2 or similar method as approved by the Superintendent while in the presence of the Client.
○ Areas of subgrade identified by the superintendent as unsuitable material shall be excavated and replaced with material conforming to the requirements of the overlying fill zone
Specifications - Scarify minimum 150mm, moisture condition and compact.
○ The Superintendent shall inspect the subgrade for conformance with the specification prior to placement of overlying fill.
Foundation Preparation – Smooth drum rolling of material
Specifications - Prior to the placemat of construction materials, the subgrade shall be rolled using a smooth drum roller to form a hard-smooth surface and approved by the superintendent.
Specifications - The foundation surface level shall be scarified, watered and compacted to a density ratio of no less than 96% of standard MDD and -+2 % of OMC
Specifications - Finished levels checked for Vertical and horizontal tolerances as required.
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP004 - EC - Embankment Construction - Rev1
Specifications - Location of Works identified in accordance with project technical specification
Specifications - Foundation preparation works completed in underlying lot

Specifications - Placed in continuous, approximately horizontal layers for the full width of the area, having a compacted thickness of not more than 300 mm or less than 150 mm. If the surface of any layer is smooth, it must be scarified to a depth of approximately 30 to 50 mm prior to the placement of the next layer.
○ NOTE: 98% standard MDD for the Earthen Ring Beam General Fill Section.
Specifications - RSA shall submit 0% and 100% tank pad foundation fill placement completion survey to the superintendent within 48 hours of each milestone achievement
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP005 - CL - Capping Layer - Rev1
Specifications - Location of work identified in accordance with project technical specification
Specifications - Compaction Trial to be completed and approved
Specifications - Material shall meet the requirements under Queensland Department of Main Roads Technical Specification (MRTS)05 Type 2.5
Specifications - Main Roads Technical Specification (MRTS) 04 General Earthworks Section 18.3.2 or similar method as approved by the Superintendent while in the presence of the Client

Specifications - Access track and ring road capped with 200 mm depth gravel. Placed in continuous, approximately horizontal layers having a compacted thickness of not less than 75 mm and not more than 200 mm. If the surface of any layer is smooth it must be lightly scarified to a depth of approximately 30 to 50 mm prior to the placement of the next layer.
Specifications - Capping Material shall be tested for material characteristics, moisture, and compaction.
Specifications - Finished levels checked for Vertical and horizontal tolerances as required.
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP006 - Surface Water Runoff Management - Rev1
Prompting Name: Checklist - ITP006 - Surface Water Runoff Management

Name: Specifications - Location of works identify as per IFC drawings
Specifications - Apply gypsum to batters and table drains at rate of 5t/ha, scarify subsoil to a minimum depth of 150mm and apply 10mm/m2 to create adequate topsoil bond with the subgrade.
Specifications - Topsoil to be ameliorated with DAP Fertilizer at the rate of 150kg per Ha. If required.

Specifications - Topsoil is to be placed 300mm thick and trim with grader and scarify to a depth of 100mm.Surface left in a roughened state with horizontal rills running across the slopes to minimise potential erosion.
Specifications - Topsoil to be seeded at sowing rate as per client requirements. If Required
Specifications - Watering 10mm/m2 every day for first 8 days, then every second day to get to a total of 14 irrigation days. If required
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP007 - Erosion and Sediment Control Installation - RevA
Prompting Name: Checklist - ITP007 - Erosion and Sediment Control Installation

Name: Specifications - Location of works identify as per IFC drawings
Clear identification and demarcation of ‘no go zones’ (where required)
Specifications - Remove vegetation and disturb soil only in those areas approved for construction work to occur.
Installation of temporary sediment and erosion control devices.
○ Generally in accordance with DWG 1484.00.010 and as agreed onsite.
Sediment and erosion control device ongoing inspections.
Specifications - Inspection of sediment and erosion control devices completed to be completed at the below frequencies
○ Rain: >50mm in on day or >100mm over 4 days
Specifications - The Superintendent must have a visual inspection of the subgrade, prior to the placement of the Separation Geotextile
Specifications - The Contractor shall supply the Superintendent with manufacturer Quality Control (MQC) data
Specifications - The Contractor shall supply the Superintendent with manufacturer Quality Control (MQC) data certificates.
Specifications - Installation method comply with the requirements of the technical specification and the IFC drawings.
○ Separation Geotextile shall be weighted with sandbags or equivalent until covered with overlying materials.
○ Laps to geotextiles shall be a minimum 0.6m
○ The Superintendent shall inspect the placement of Geotextile for conformance with this Technical Specification prior to placement of overlying layers.
○ Separation Geotextile must be covered by overlying construction activities within one week of being rolled out.
Specifications - Area cleared of soil or other deleterious materials.
○ A patch placed from the same Geotextile of minimum 0.6 m lap to intact Geotextile on all sides and final patch approved by the Superintendent.
Specifications - Rip Rap shall be provided to superintendent.
○ Rip rap to be placed by excavator over the separation geotextile.
○ Rock finished smoothed to the final lines and levels
Specifications - The Superintendent must approve the finish surface and underlying separation geotextile installation of the Rip Rap prior to completion of works.
Specifications - Excavation to design invert levels allowing for 100mm bedding sand (or equivalent)
○ Rubber ring joint Class 2 RCP installed with barrels laid straight free from damage.
○ Sand (or equivalent) haunching and overlay to approximately 150mm above pipe
○ Foundation to be tested for bearing capacity of 100kPa
Specifications - Trench backfilled and tested in line with requirements for Fill
Specifications - Headwalls installed on 100mm sand bedding to required invert levels
○ Headwall installed flush with RCP pipe and grouted neat.
Specifications - Conformance certificates supplied by manufacturer
○ All required test reports provided to client
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
Checklist - ITP008 - LD - Installation of Leak Detection Pipe and Sump - Rev0
Prompting Name: Checklist - ITP008 - LD - Installation of Leak Detection Pipe and Sump

Name: Specifications - Location of works identified as per IFC drawings
Specifications - Confirm centres of both sump and tank locations
Specifications - Location Minimum 3m from outside edge of ring beam (to be confirmed)
○ Sump excavated to correct dimensions in line with Concept Environmental Services (CES) DWG 221212-DR-004.
○ 0.8m diameter excavation to design depth. Sump pit depth to be determined onsite ensuring sufficient fall from tank centre to sump
Installation of HDPE sump base and chamber at correct height and level
Specifications - Poly sump base to be installed at 200mm below leak detection pipe.
○ Sump chamber installed plumb to correct height minimum 150mm above top of tank
Specifications - Backfill in accordance with CES requirements. Compaction testing in line with Earthworks specification.
Specifications - Trench excavated to correct lines and levels inline with CES drawings.
○ Sufficient excavation width to facilitate installation.
Specifications - 50mm HDPE pipe and bends installed in accordance with CES and manufacturer requirements.
○ Minimum 150mm cover at centre of tank
○ Pipe installed on 50mm sand bedding (optional) as per CES recommendations
○ HDPE pipe riser installed 300mm above FSL at centre of tank, temporary seal to prevent sediment ingress.
○ Pipe to be left exposed at centre of sump pit
Specifications - Backfill in accordance with CES requirements and general earthworks specifications
Specifications - Work completed in accordance with CES requirements.
○ Compaction reports received and meeting specification
Inspection: I declare that the above work has been inspected, and the recorded results of the inspections are correct.
Verification: I verify that the recorded results of the above inspections are correct.
